You were told not to do something or you will be punished. Did you do it?

Your ban looks justified to me, but for those that somehow think you have a shred of a case against Riot Games, let me debunk that notion for you immediately (with one exception): 

1)  You agreed to the Terms of Use and the End User License Agreement prior to playing this game.  

2)  You are given the privilege to use digital content which may be revoked at any time, for any reason, or no reason at all.  You do not own this content and that access is temporary.  

3)  "But what if a minor (a person under the age of 18/17---depending upon jurisdiction) agrees to this contract?  Minors can't enter legally binding agreements".  This is a much more interesting situation, however starting a "class action suit" will net you absolutely nothing because in a class action suit, the lawyers get most of the money and the hordes of plaintiffs get zero.  

ON THE OTHER HAND, if you file a small claims case---which is what your case would fall under because the damages are less than $5,000-$7,500 (which is hte statutory maximum for small claims in most states), then you may have a chance.  Remember, in small claims court, there are no lawyers, it's just the litigants involved... plaintiff and defendant in front of a judge.  All you would have to do is prove you were a minor at the time of the transaction and boom, you win.  

The adults that want to claim they could get legal help are out of luck, however, because you do have the ability to enter a legally binding contract and you have no case.

Doing so essentially covers them, because it means that if you click that link you are stating that you're of the age of majority and you can legally enter a contract.  If you aren't over the age of 18 and click that link, then you are committing fraud and Riot could simply have the defense, "they said they were 18, we made a reasonable effort to engage in a good faith contract".
